snippet: A Franco-American regiment celebrates the New Year with the president.
abstract: A Franco-American regiment celebrates the New Year with the president.
lead_paragraph: By January 1862, fighting had quieted down in the East. The troops were in winter quarters, and the new Union commander, Gen. George McClellan, was sick with typhoid fever. Only President Lincoln seemed to be champing at the bit for action. The day after Christmas he had ordered Gen. Ambrose Burnside "to be off at once." Exactly where Burnside was to go, Lincoln didn't say, so everyone stayed put.
